metadata.title: Tuesday, 24th September, 2013
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)why funding to Yeta Hospital in Sesheke District is erratic;
(b)whether the Government is aware that the erratic funding negatively affects the smooth running of the Hospital;
(c)what measures have been taken to correct the situation; and
(d)when the Hospital will be provided with an ambulance.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth and Sport
parts: (a)whether the Government has any plans to renovate Kaole Stadium in Mansa and, if so, when; and
(b)whether the Government has any plans to build a modern sports facility in Luapula as the case is for other Provinces.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the recently opened Chisamba High School will be electrified.
Minister of Lands, Natural Resources and Environmental Protection what measures the Ministry has taken to make land in Kabwe District available for investment.
Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)whether the Ministry is aware that some health centres in Kaputa Parliamentary Constituency are manned by unqualified personnel and, if so, when the Ministry will correct the anomaly; and
(b)whether nurses are qualified to head health centres.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock
parts: (a)whether the Government owes any money to seed marketing companies and transporters of agro-inputs who were engaged to supply and transport agro-inputs to various parts of the country during the 2012/2013 farming season and, if so, how much the debt is;
(b)when the debt will be paid; and
(c)what the reason for the delay in paying off the debt is.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)why ZESCO Limited, whose core business is power generation, transmission and distribution, owns a commercial licence in communication;
(b)what the purpose of the licence is;
(c)what the capacity of the fibre optic cable owned by ZESCO is; and
(d)whether the optic fibre at (c) can be used by Zamtel Limited whose core business is telecommunication.

questions.minister: Minister of Defence
parts: (a)when Mulungushi Textiles will resume industrial production;
(b)why it has taken long for the Company to resume operations; and
(c)what measures have been taken to ensure that the Company operates profitably in future.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the Government will rehabilitate the following primary schools in Nakonde Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)Chitamane;
(b)Itutu;
(c)Ndanji;
(d)Lukumba;
(e)Chawa; and
(f)Zyongo.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs whether the
questions.question_text: Government has any plans to construct a prison in Nakonde District.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a)whether the Government has any plans to resuscitate the operations of the Kawambwa Tea Company; and
(b)if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Tourism and Art
parts: (a)when Isangano National Park in Luwingu District will be re-stocked with wild animals;
(b)what animal species will be re-stocked in the Park;
(c)whether the re-stocking exercise will be based on the Public Private Partnership arrangement; and
(d)if so, who the possible partners are.

questions.minister: Minister of Health
parts: (a)whether the Government has any plans to construct a new district hospital in Luwingu to cater for the growing population; and
(b)if so, when the construction of the hospital will commence.

questions.minister: Minister of Finance
parts: (a)in which sectors the Euro bond loan was invested;
(b)how much money from the Euro bond was spent as of 31st August, 2013;
(c)whether the Government has already started servicing the loan; and
(d)if so, how much has been repaid in terms of both the principal and interest.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)why Ventilated Improved Pit Latrines were constructed first, instead of classroom blocks, at the following primary school sites in Kabompo West Parliamentary Constituency:
(i)Chifuwe South; (ii)Chifuwe Minunga; and (iii)Kafungo; and
(b)when the classroom blocks at the sites at (a) will be constructed.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs whether the Government policy of not recognising additional Chiefs since 1964 has now changed.
Minister of Agriculture and Livestock
parts: (a)    how many 50kg bags of compound D and urea fertilizer were given to small scale farmers in the following Parliamentary Constituencies in 2012:
(i)Mumbwa Central; (ii)Mwembeshi; and (iii)Nangoma; and
(b)    how many bags of compound D and urea fertilizer are earmarked for distribution in 2013/2014 farming season in the newly created Shibuyunji District.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)where the official boundaries of Chief Matebo, Senior Chief Mukumbi and Senior Chief Musele of Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency lie; and
(b)when the Government will start sensitising the people of Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency on the chiefdom boundaries based on the 1958 map which designates official chiefdom boundaries.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health when the following health centres in Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency will be provided with medical personnel
parts: (a)Kisasa;
(b)Maheba; and
(c)Mutanda.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when Government will build more grain storage facilities in Kaoma District considering that a lot of maize goes to waste due to inadequate storage facilities.
Minister of Lands, Natural Resources and Environmental Protection
parts: (a)how much honey and wax was produced in Kaoma District from January, 2011 to July 2013; and
(b)whether the Government has any plans to re-open the honey factory in the District.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)whether the Ministry is aware that no Government staff houses have been constructed at the following primary schools in Chitambo Parliamentary Constituency since the schools were opened:
(i)Lubembe and Kabola in Muchinka Ward; and (ii)Chipundu in Chipundu Ward; and
(b)if so, when construction of the houses for the schools will commence.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs whether the Government has any plans to build infrastructure at the David Livingstone Memorial Site in Chipundu Ward in Chitambo Parliamentary Constituency.
Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development when the project to connect Mwinilunga District to the national electricity grid will be completed.
Minister of Local Government and Housing when the construction of the new civic centre for Mwinilunga District Council, where works have stalled, will be completed.
questions.question_text: NOTICE OF MOTION Mr Mushanga Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address :  That the thanks of this Assembly be recorded for the exposition of public policy contained in His Excellency the President’s Address.
